required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single Follicular Dexarelix for LH Suppression During Ovarian Stimulation in Oocyte Donors.
clinical_study.official_title: Single Follicular Dexarelix, a New Long Acting GnRH- Antagonist for LH Suppression During Ovarian Stimulation in Oocyte Donors. A Randomised Control Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized prospective study in the evaluation of the long acting GnRH antagonist Degarelix against the classical multidose regime with Ganirelix for LH suppression during the follicular phase of an ovarian stimulation cycle in oocyte donors.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized prospective study of the use of single dose of the long acting GnRH antagonist Degarelix for ovarian stimulation cycle in oocyte donors: Ovarian stimulation started on cycle Day2 with gonadotropins 175-300 IU and either GnRH antagonist single dose Degarelix or multidose GnRH antagonist Ganirelix initiated on Day6 of the stimulation cycle. Agonist triggering was used in both groups for oocyte maturation. Blastocyst formation rate and Live Birth Rates were estimated for both groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Live birth rate according to stimulation protocol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 38 weeks after embryo transfer
primary_outcome.description: Live birth rate according to stimulation protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Blastulation rate according to stimulation protocol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 days post oocyte retrieval
secondary_outcome.description: Blastulation rate according to stimulation protocol

arm_group.description: The blastocyst formation rate and live birth rates of patients who followed GnRH antagonist protocol with a single dose Degarelix.
The blastocyst formation rate and live birth rates of patients who followed GnRH antagonist protocol with multidose dose Ganirelix.

intervention.description: The blastulation rate and live birth rate according to the protocol of COS

study_pop.textblock: Women 20-34 years old who follow COS with a single GnRH antagonist Degarelix or multidose GnRH antagonist Ganirelix.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Papanikolaou Evaggelos, MD, PhD, Fertility Specialist, Scientific Director at Assisting Nature IVF Clinic
